notes.text:
TOP TIP
You can make the stew up to a week in advance and refrigerate it in an airtight container (it gets even better the longer it sits) or freeze it in an airtight container for up to 2 months (defrost in the refrigerator for up to a day before serving). Gently rewarm the stew in a heavy pot set over low heat before serving.

steps.descr: Warm the oil in a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot set over medium heat.

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by warming up some oil in a large pot over medium heat. You'll know it's ready when it shimmers.

steps.instructions: Warm the oil in a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot set over medium heat.

steps.descr: Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until just beginning to soften, about 3 minutes.

on_enter.say: Now, let's toss in the onion and garlic. Give it a stir every now and then, and in about 3 minutes, they'll start to soften and smell wonderful.

steps.instructions: Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until just beginning to soften, about 3 minutes.

steps.descr: Stir in the Xawaash, tomato paste, and salt and cook until aromatic, about 1 minute.

on_enter.say: Time to add some spice! Stir in the Xawaash, tomato paste, and salt. Cook it for about a minute until it smells absolutely divine.

steps.instructions: Stir in the Xawaash, tomato paste, and salt and cook until aromatic, about 1 minute.

steps.descr: Stir in the water and increase the heat to high. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, then stir in the beef and potatoes.

on_enter.say: Let's add the water and crank up the heat. Once it's boiling, we'll lower the heat and add in our beef and potatoes. It's going to be delicious!

steps.instructions: Stir in the water and increase the heat to high. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, then stir in the beef and potatoes.

steps.descr: Partially cover the pot (leave the lid slightly ajar so steam can escape) and simmer until the beef and potatoes are just cooked through, about 45 minutes.

on_enter.say: Now, let's partially cover the pot and let it simmer gently for about 45 minutes. This will make the beef and potatoes beautifully tender.

steps.instructions: Partially cover the pot (leave the lid slightly ajar so steam can escape) and simmer until the beef and potatoes are just cooked through, about 45 minutes.

steps.descr: Stir in the carrots and bell pepper and cook, covered, until the beef and vegetables are all very tender, an additional 30 minutes.

on_enter.say: Let's add the carrots and bell pepper to the pot. Cover it up and let it cook for another 30 minutes until everything is tender and full of flavor.

steps.instructions: Stir in the carrots and bell pepper and cook, covered, until the beef and vegetables are all very tender, an additional 30 minutes.

steps.descr: Season the stew to taste with salt and serve over rice with hot sauce and cilantro for topping, lime wedges for squeezing

on_enter.say: Finally, let's season our stew to perfection. Serve it over some rice and top with hot sauce, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime. Enjoy!

steps.instructions: Season the stew to taste with salt and serve over rice with hot sauce and cilantro for topping, lime wedges for squeezing
